poem:
### Call of the Willing

Red wheelbarrows clutter the dawn,  
where voices stir in static air.  
Trump whispers to Putin—  
discord in the dance of static,  
while Starmer counts coalitions  
under flickering streetlamps,  
a shadowed pact,  
life suspended on a wire,  
chaos waiting to fracture  
the soiled peace of morning.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump and Putin to hold call on US plans for Ukraine ceasefire – Europe live 12.07pm GMT UK prime minister Starmer spoke with Trump on Ukraine last night We are now getting a line from Downing Street that UK prime minister Keir Starmer spoke with US president Donald Trump last night, ahead of the Trump-Putin call later today. Starmer’s spokesperson said that “the prime minister updated the President on his ‘Coalition of the Willing’ call". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
